rules.allergen_assessment: An allergen assessment identifies all allergens (as defined by FALCPA and customer requirements) present in the facility including raw materials, ingredients, rework, and finished products.
rules.allergen_register: An allergen register is maintained listing all products containing each allergen. The register is updated when formulations change or new products are introduced.
rules.dedicated_equipment: Where feasible, dedicated equipment, utensils, and storage containers are used for allergen-containing products. Dedicated items are clearly identified and labeled.
rules.changeover_procedures: Production changeover procedures define the sequence from high-allergen to low-allergen or allergen-free products. Allergen-containing products are scheduled last in production runs where possible.
rules.cleaning_validation: Allergen cleaning procedures are validated to demonstrate effective allergen removal. Validation methods include ATP testing, allergen swabs, or visual inspection with defined acceptance criteria.
rules.rework_allergen_control: Rework containing allergens is controlled to prevent cross-contact. Rework is only added to products containing the same allergen and at levels that do not affect label accuracy.
rules.labeling_verification: Label verification procedures ensure allergen information is accurate and complete. Labels are reviewed and approved before use, and label application is verified during production.
rules.supplier_allergen_control: Suppliers are required to declare all allergens in raw materials and ingredients. Allergen status is verified through COAs, specifications, and supplier audits.
rules.allergen_training: All personnel handling allergens receive training on cross-contact prevention, cleaning procedures, rework control, and label accuracy. Training is documented and conducted annually.
rules.storage_segregation: Allergen-containing materials are stored separately from allergen-free materials or protected to prevent cross-contact. Storage areas are clearly labeled to identify allergen presence.
